cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay states it will explore the origins of urban legends as one of its main topics.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject (a text, question, discourse, or conceptual focus) is about or thematically concerned with the object topic.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay aims to explore the impact of urban legends on society.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document, text, or discourse primarily concerns or discusses a given topic or subject matter.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: impact of urban legends on society

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The essay will discuss why urban legends continue to endure.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a document, text, or discourse primarily concerns or discusses a given topic or subject matter.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The young couple hears the news report as part of the narrative.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject receives or obtains information or a message from the object.

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: when parked in a secluded area

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The news report provides information about the escaped criminal.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an information-bearing entity (e.g., document, report, narrative) is about or describes a particular entity or topic.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an information-bearing entity (such as an essay, report, or narrative) is about or thematically focused on the object topic or entity.
args.justification: All four relations link a text-like, information-bearing subject (essay or news report) to the topic or entity it discusses, so they share the same aboutness predicate. Normalizing them under a single canonical description and the class 'document_topic_relation' improves schema consistency. The broad semantic dimension is aboutness/association between document and topic, so 'ASSOCIATION' is more accurate and uniform than mixing 'ASSOCIATION' and 'INFORMATION'.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an information-bearing entity (such as an essay, report, or narrative) is about or thematically focused on the object topic or entity.
executed_decisions.justification: All four relations link a text-like, information-bearing subject (essay or news report) to the topic or entity it discusses, so they share the same aboutness predicate. Normalizing them under a single canonical description and the class 'document_topic_relation' improves schema consistency. The broad semantic dimension is aboutness/association between document and topic, so 'ASSOCIATION' is more accurate and uniform than mixing 'ASSOCIATION' and 'INFORMATION'.
